document.docAuthor: Niu, Ze-Qing, Oremek, Pia & Zhu, Chao-Dong
document.masterDocTitle: First record of the bee genus Homalictus Cockerell for China with description of a new species (Hymenoptera: Halictidae: Halictini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: First record of the bee genus Homalictus Cockerell for China with description of a new species (Hymenoptera: Halictidae: Halictini)

subSubSection.paragraph:
(
Figs 1
a–f, 2 a–h, female; 3 a–h, 4 a–d, male)

Diagnosis.
Homalictus nabanensis
sp.n. belongs to
Homalictus
s. str. by its carinate propodeum. It is ended to
H . behri (Cockerell, 1910 )
following the key of Walker ( 1986 ), but it can be distinguished from
H . behri
by the following combination of characters: Body with metallic greenish reflexions, propodeum, metasoma and legs black, tarsi yellowish brown in female, tarsi and tibias yellowish brown in males; female scutum superficially reticulate, not distinctly punctuate (
Fig 2
b); dorsal surface of propodeum with strong rugae reaching rim of propodeum (
Fig 2
c); disc of S 2 –S 5 with brown hairs; and male genitalia with uniquely shaped penis valve.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1.
Homalictus
( H .)
nabanensis
sp. n.
, female. a: Body in lateral view; b: Right fore wing, showing the weakened distal wing venation; c: Proboscides, showing the distal part of galea; d: Fore tibia, showing the malus of strigilis; e: Hind tibia, showing the basitibial plate; f: Hind tibia, showing the inner tibia spur. Scale bar: a, b: 1mm; c, d, e, f: 0.5mm.

FIGURE 2.
Homalictus
( H .)
nabanensis
sp. n.
, female. a: Head in frontal view; b: Scutum in dorsal view; c: Propodeum in dorsal view; d: Metasoma in dorsal view; e: Metasoma in lateral view; f: Hind tibia, showing outer surface; g: Metasoma in ventral view, showing the hair series on S2-S5; h: Distal part of metasoma in dorsal view, showing prepygidial fimbria and the longitudinal median specialized area of T5. Scale bar: a, b, f: 0.5mm; c, d, e. g, h: 1mm.

FIGURE 3.
Homalictus
( H .)
nabanensis
sp. n.
, male. a: Body in lateral view; b: Head in frontal view; c: Proboscides, showing the distal part of galea; d: Right fore wing, showing the weakened distal wing venation; e: Fore tibia, showing the malus of strigilis; f: Hind femur and tibia, showing the basitibial plate; g: Hind tibia, showing the inner tibia spur; h: Scutum in dorsal view. Scale bar: a, d: 1mm; b, c, e, f, g, h: 0.5mm.

FIGURE 4.
Homalictus
( H .)
nabanensis
sp. n.
, male. a: Propodeum in dorsal view; b: Metasoma in dorsal view; c: Genitalia in dorsal view; d: Genitalia in lateral view. Scale bar: a, c, d: 0.5mm; b: 1mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description. Female, flagellum 10 –segmented, metasoma with five segments exposed, prepygidial fimbria separated by a longitudinal median specialized area of T 5 (
Fig 2
h). BL=5.0–5.5mm ( holotype : 5.5mm) (
Fig 1
a); first recurrent vein meets second submarginal crossvein, second recurrent vein enters third marginal cell (
Fig 1
b); fore basitarsal comb fan shaped (
Fig 1
d); hind basitibal plate complete and angulate apically (
Fig 1
e); hind inner tibial spur with three teeth (
Fig 1
f); outer undersurface of hind tibia concave (
Fig 2
f); head broader than long, HW: HL = 47 : 38 , UOD: MOD: LOD: IOD: OOD = 22 : 35 : 25 : 7 : 7 (
Fig 2
d); antenna geniculate; clypeus slightly convex, broader than long, width as nearly three times as its length, supraclypeal area obviously convex, antennal sockets separated by distance equal to diameter of socket (
Fig 2
a), gena slightly narrower than eye, GW: EW = 9 : 11 ; malar area absent; metasoma broader than that between tegulae, MtW: TW = 56 : 51 . Frons and paraocular area with vertical striate, clypeus and supraclypeal area finely reticulate, no punctuate (
Fig 2
a); scutum reticulate (
Fig 2
b), without distinct punctuations; dorsal surface of propodeum sparsely reticulate, with strong rugae reaching rim of propodeum (
Fig 2
c); metasomal terga no punctuate, shiny and transversely fine lineolate (
Fig 2
d). Clypeus brassy with metallic reflection, supraclypeal area greenish blue with metallic reflection (
Fig 2
a); scutum greenish blue intermixed with brassy metallic reflection (
Fig 2
b); antennal flagellum ventrally dark blackish brown; distal 2 / 3 part of mandible reddish brown, basal 1 / 3 part black; tarsi yellowish brown, other parts of all legs black; frons, paraocular area, pronotum, scutellum, metanotum, propodeum and metasomal terga black. Clypeus, paraocular area, vertex, and scutum with yellowish white plumose hairs; gena, pronotal lobe and posterior surface of propodeum with white long plumose hairs; disc of T 2 –T 3 with brown short simple hairs; ventrolateral parts of T 1 – T 3 with numerous large yellowish brown plumose hair branches (
Fig 2
e); plumose hair series of S 2 –S 5 brown (
Fig 2
g).

Male, flagellum 11 -segmented, metasoma with seven segments exposed. BL=4.7–5.0mm (
Fig 3
a); head broader than long, HW: HL = 44 : 35 , UOD: MOD: LOD: IOD: OOD = 25 : 29 : 20 : 6 : 6 (
Fig 3
b); antenna geniculate; gena slightly narrower than eye, GW: EW = 8 : 10 ; malar area absent; clypeus slightly convex, broader than long, width as nearly three times as its length, supraclypeal area convex, antennal sockets separated by distance equal to diameter of socket (
Fig 3
b); metasoma slightly narrower than that between tegulae, MtW: TW = 50 : 55 ; wing venation of fore wing as same as that of female, first recurrent vein meets second submarginal crossvein, second recurrent vein enters third marginal cell (
Fig 3
d); fore basitarsal comb fan shaped (
Fig 3
e); hind basitibal plate complete and angulate apically (
Fig 3
f); hind inner tibial spur with three teeth, hind tibia normal, without concave on outer undersurface (
Fig 3
g). Frons and paraocular area with vertical striate, clypeus and supraclypeal area finely reticulate, no punctuate (
Fig 3
b); scutum finely reticulate, sparsely punctate (
Fig 3
h); dorsal surface of propodeum sparsely reticulate, median with a few longitudinal strong rugae reaching rim of propodeum (
Fig 4
a); metasomal terga no punctuate, shiny and transversely fine lineolate (
Fig 4
b); gonobase slightly narrower than gonocoxite (
Fig 4
c), penis valve long, tapering sharp apically and bending ventrally (
Fig 4
d). Clypeus, supraclypeal area, and scutum greenish blue; pronotum, scutellum, metanotum, propodeum and metasomal terga black; antennal flagellum ventrally dark blackish brown; apical 1 / 3 part of mandible reddish black, middle part yellowish brown, basal part black; tibiae and tarsi yellowish brown, other parts of all legs black. Clypeus covered with denser yellowish white plumose hairs; gena and scutum with sparse white plumose hairs; disc of S 2 –S 5 with sparse yellowish brown branched hairs.

Type material.
Holotype , 1 ♀, China , Yunnan, Xishuangbanna, NRWNNR (
100 ° 32 ′E
22 º04′N
),

Distribution. China (Yunnan) and presumably Thailand (Chiang Mai), see above.
Etymology. The type location Naban ( China , Yunnan) is used to name the species.
